title: Online Safety Amendment (Social Media Minimum Age) Act 2024
scope_summary: Age-restricted social media platforms must take reasonable steps to prevent under-16s in Australia from having accounts; penalties on platforms, not kids/parents.

title: Online Safety Act – children’s safety duties and age assurance
status: in force (child safety duties from 25 Jul 2025)
scope_summary: Platforms accessible in the UK have duties to protect children; must use highly effective age assurance to prevent children accessing certain content (incl pornography and self-harm/suicide/eating-disorder content).

title: European Commission guidelines on protection of minors under the Digital Services Act (Article 28) + age verification blueprint/prototype
scope_summary: DSA imposes obligations to ensure high levels of privacy, safety and security for minors; Commission published guidelines and an age verification blueprint/prototype designed to be privacy-preserving and interoperable with EU Digital Identity Wallets.

title: Florida HB 3 (2024) – social media restrictions for minors
status: litigated; injunction June 2025; allowed to enforce (appeal) Nov 2025 (check current posture)
scope_summary: Requires platforms to terminate accounts for <14; 14-15 need parental consent; statutory language includes termination and dispute window; enforcement status affected by litigation.

title: Utah app store age verification + parental consent law (effective May 7, 2025)
scope_summary: Requires app stores to verify age and obtain parental consent for minors before downloads (and/or account creation flows depending on final law).

title: Texas SB 2420 – App Store Accountability Act (age verification + parental consent)
status: scheduled to take effect Jan 1 (lawsuits filed)
scope_summary: Would require app stores to verify age and obtain parental consent for users under 18 before downloading apps (with exceptions). Litigation seeks to block.

title: Tennessee Protecting Kids from Social Media Act (HB 1891)
status: in effect Jan 1, 2025 (age verification + parental consent)
scope_summary: Requires social media platforms to verify age and obtain parental consent for minors (under 18).

title: Arkansas Social Media Safety Act (Act 689 / SB 689)
scope_summary: Required social media platforms to verify age and restrict minors; struck down as unconstitutional and permanently enjoined.

title: Ireland Online Safety Code (Coimisiún na Meán)
status: adopted; enforcement in/around July 2025 for covered services (see guidance)
scope_summary: Applies to video-sharing platform services; requires measures to protect children incl. age verification, parental controls, reporting/flagging, and restricting certain harmful content categories.

title: Law No. 2023-566 establishing 'digital majority' and combating online hate (social networks under-15 parental consent)
status: adopted; reported as not fully applied pending implementing decree / EU processes
scope_summary: Requires social network providers operating in France to refuse registration of minors under 15 unless authorized by a legal guardian; implementation depends on decrees/technical mechanisms and EU considerations.

title: Youth Media Protection Interstate Treaty (JMStV) – online youth protection and age assurance measures
scope_summary: Requires protections for minors for certain content; can involve technical measures such as age verification and access restrictions for content unsuitable for minors.

title: Digital Statute for Children and Adolescents (ECA Digital)
min_age_rule: platform obligations; app downloads 12–18 require guardian consent (reported)
scope_summary: Framework for minors online including obligations for providers; includes age verification mechanisms and parental/guardian consent for certain minors’ app downloads; other youth protections (e.g., advertising restrictions) noted in analyses.

title: Digital Personal Data Protection Act 2023 – children’s data (verifiable parental consent)
min_age_rule: <18 parental consent for processing children's personal data
scope_summary: Requires verifiable parental consent for processing personal data of children; impacts platforms’ onboarding and age/consent workflows even absent a social-media-specific age minimum.

title: Singapore Online Safety Code of Practice for App Distribution Services (age assurance)
min_age_rule: age assurance for children accessing age-inappropriate apps
scope_summary: Requires designated app stores to implement age assurance to protect children from age-inappropriate apps based on ratings; does not prescribe a single method and may allow age estimation.

title: Malaysia policy to ban social media accounts for under-16s (announced)
scope_summary: Reported policy to prohibit social media accounts for under-16s starting 2026; implementation details under development (age verification methods under consideration).

title: Indonesia child protection regulation for digital platforms (reported as PP Tunas)
scope_summary: Reported regulation would require platforms to restrict sign-ups for ages 13–16 unless parental consent; details and final text should be verified from official publication when available.

title: Bill S-209: Protecting Young Persons from Exposure to Pornography Act (age verification for explicit content)
min_age_rule: <18 prohibited from commercial pornography absent age verification
scope_summary: Would create offence for making pornographic material available to young persons online; drives age verification requirements (content-specific; not general social media).

title: Norway consultation proposal: absolute age limit 15 for access to social media platforms
scope_summary: Government announced a public consultation proposal for a new law introducing an absolute age limit of 15 years for access to social media platforms.

title: Denmark political agreement: minimum age 15 for certain social media (with parental opt-in from 13)
scope_summary: Government announced agreement to restrict access/self-registration for under-15s on certain social media platforms; reporting references parental opt-in for ages 13–14; implementation expected mid-2026.

title: Netherlands: age limit 16 for consent (GDPR Article 8)
scope_summary: Dutch DPA states an age limit of 16 applies for consent; under 16 requires authorization by holder of parental responsibility for consent-based processing of children’s data for information society services.

title: Spain draft organic law to protect minors in digital environments (sent to Parliament)
scope_summary: Government sent draft organic law to Parliament; reported provisions include raising the age threshold for valid consent online (14→16) and restricting minors’ registration on social networks.

title: EU FRA mapping: Italy minimum age requirements for consent (GDPR Article 8 context)
min_age_rule: Italy listed under parental-consent regime; commonly referenced threshold 14
scope_summary: EU FRA mapping of Member State approaches to child consent under Article 8 GDPR; useful for identifying baseline consent regimes impacting onboarding and data processing.

title: Saudi Arabia PDPL: guardian consent where data subject lacks legal capacity (incl. minors)
scope_summary: Overview indicates PDPL statute lacks explicit children definition but implementing regulations include guardian consent for those lacking legal capacity; relevant to consent flows for minors.

title: UAE PDPL (Federal Law No. 45 of 2021): no child-specific consent provisions noted
status: in force (baseline privacy law); child provisions absent per analysis
scope_summary: Legal analysis notes the UAE PDPL applies generally but does not include specific provisions on processing children's personal data or parental consent; track for future amendments or sector rules.
